<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Sending virtual Sonic Limeades to our readers out West, where things are getting punishingly hot. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>40 million people will experience temps of 100°F or more in the coming days.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The low in Phoenix Tuesday night was 91°. The low. Was 91. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Salt Lake City tied its all-time record at 107°.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But hey, look on the bright side. You could be a Sixers fan. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/fed-boosts-inflation-projections-signals-rate-hike-2023?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What to Expect When You’re Expecting Rate Hikes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/fed-boosts-inflation-projections-signals-rate-hike-2023?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Jerome Powell sitting at a desk looking concerned " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMwL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just like your friend’s Covid-delayed wedding, the Fed’s interest rate hikes <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/fed-expected-flag-start-monetary-policy-shift-debate-2021-06-16/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finally have a date</a>: 2023. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By then, central bankers project, the economy will be in a strong enough position for the Fed to raise interest rates that influence everything from mortgages to business investments. 2023 is one year earlier than the Fed’s previous estimates.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why move the timeline up? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All those sweet, sweet antibodies coursing through your immune system. Says the Fed: “Progress on vaccinations has reduced the spread of Covid-19 in the United States" and therefore “indicators of economic activity and employment have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/federal-reserve-meeting-interest-rates-bond-purchases-june-2021-11623777582?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strengthened</a>.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nearly 45% of the US population is fully vaccinated, and hard-hit states like California and New York removed most Covid-related restrictions this week.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here: </strong>In March 2020, the Fed dropped interest rates to near-zero and launched a barrage of stimulus measures to steer the economy through its darkest days. It worked pretty well, and the question the Fed’s faced recently is: When has the economy recovered enough that these stimulus efforts, including a bond-buying program and super-low interest rates, aren’t needed? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re not there yet. The Fed said it wouldn’t further update its strategy until “substantial further progress” is made. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But what about inflation? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Fed has been pressured to pump the brakes on the economy after a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/inflation-rising-economy-weird?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">run-up in prices</a> this spring led to the highest inflation readings in years. Powell has consistently argued that higher inflation is temporary, but now he may be taking it a little more seriously: “Inflation could turn out to be higher and more persistent than we expect,” he <a href="https://twitter.com/YahooFinance/status/1405236329806446592?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>, while the Fed revised its inflation expectations higher. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the interest rate hikes in 2023 are just central bankers’ expectations, and could change based on the shape of the recovery. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F16%2Ffed-boosts-inflation-projections-signals-rate-hike-2023" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/biden-putin-discuss-cybersecurity-geneva-summit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biden and Putin Get Up Close and Political
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/biden-putin-discuss-cybersecurity-geneva-summit?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="GENEVA, SWITZERLAND - JUNE 16: US president Joe Biden (L) and Russia's P..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDYyL3VzLXJ1c3NpYV9zdW1taXRfMjAyMV9pbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin met face-to-face in Geneva yesterday to discuss light dinner-table topics including human rights, nuclear treaties, and—the one we’re focusing on—cybersecurity. But first, to set the scene... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Biden called Putin a “worthy adversary” leading up to the summit and gifted him a </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/biden-putin-gift-aviators-e901ef4c-d23d-4111-8e9e-8ce004f5d2f1.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crystal bison sculpture</a></span><span> and custom aviators.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Putin threw down some </span><span><a href="https://deadline.com/2021/06/vladmir-putin-abc-news-rachel-scott-joe-biden-summit-1234776343/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Russian philosophy</a></span><span> in a press conference after the meeting: “There is no happiness in life, there is only the mirage of it on the horizon, so we’ll cherish that." <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/thinking-face_1f914.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what did they say about cybersecurity?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember, both the hack of Colonial Pipeline, which led to a gas shortage on the Eastern seaboard, and the forced shut down of meat supplier JBS’s facilities in the US have been attributed to cybercrime groups operating in Russia.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What Biden wants: </strong></span><span>Russia to </span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/06/16/putin-biden-cybersecurity-494875?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take responsibility</a></span><span> for cybercriminals acting within its borders.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What Biden got: </strong></span><span>Putin agreed to “begin consultations” regarding cybersecurity with the US. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Just last week, Russia, along with 20+ other countries including the US, agreed not to shelter cybercriminals or be involved in the hacking of other nations’ infrastructure (like the Colonial Pipeline) during peacetime. However, Russia has a poor track record of upholding such agreements.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/construction-new-homes-cant-keep-says-new-report?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bring in Bob, He's Got Work to Do
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get ready for the most intense season of <em>House Hunters</em> you’ve ever seen, because construction of homes in the US in the last 20 years is 5.5 million units short of historical levels, according to a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/race-and-ethnicity-health-coronavirus-pandemic-lifestyle-business-cdce22f5ae976032e9e6fa89831c0a93?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> released yesterday by the National Association of Realtors (NAR).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic only made the bad, worse, when supply chain bottlenecks and labor shortages throttled new development. Now, the US is experiencing a housing affordability crisis: The median price of an existing home hit an all-time high of $341,600 in April, up 19% from 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> There aren’t enough houses being built to account for population growth, aging and destroyed units, or even to replace all the haunted farmhouses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>in response to the report, top WH economic advisor Brian Deese <a href="https://twitter.com/BrianDeeseNEC/status/1405189344416210954?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>, “We need a once-in-a-generation investment in increasing housing supply.” NAR released a slew of policy recommendations to accompany the report, hoping they can be folded into President Biden’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/15/infrastructure-bipartisan-senate-plan-faces-opposition-from-democrats.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">infrastructure plan</a>.</p>

<img alt="HBO Max" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTA1L3N0cmVhbWluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The average number of video streaming services utilized per US user <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/streaming-services-number-user-fatigue-1234967952/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declined</a> for the first time on record, from 7.23 in November to 7.06 in April, according to research firm Omdia. There are only so many friends’ passwords a person can remember. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “It’s very close to a nuclear disaster, what has happened here.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Muditha Katuwawala, a coordinator at Sri Lankan volunteer organization the Pearl Protectors, discussed the recent <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/interactive/2021/sri-lanka-cargo-ship-fire-pollution/?itid=hp-top-table-main&utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sinking of a cargo ship</a> off Sri Lanka’s coastline with the Washington Post.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now at the bottom of the ocean floor, the ship’s cargo of plastic pellets, chemicals, and other waste harmful to marine life is filling the surrounding water: “In the coming weeks, this is going to be a regional problem,” Katuwawala said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>What I learned at a Dodge City meatpacking plant. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2021/07/meatpacking-plant-dodge-city/619011/?utm_source=pocket&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=pockethits" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/google-opens-first-physical-retail-space-chelsea?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google Gets Physical
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/google-opens-first-physical-retail-space-chelsea?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Google's first physical retail store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=362 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/7hPTDONe67ZZGrDpEx/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Google's first physical retail store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/7hPTDONe67ZZGrDpEx/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Courtesy of Google and Paul Warchol</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As bars, restaurants, and baseball stadiums welcome more foot traffic, Google said, “Hey, gimme some of that.” This morning, the tech giant will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/16/googles-first-store-a-look-inside-where-it-will-sell-pixels-chromebooks.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open</a> its first official permanent physical retail space in NYC’s Chelsea neighborhood, which, considering all the real estate Google’s bought there, should seriously consider renaming itself Alphabet City. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>The launch of brick-and-mortar retail may seem odd for a company that makes $147 billion in revenue from digital ads. But the store is intended less as a sales generator and more as a brand-building exercise. Some highlights include...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A room full of flatscreen TVs for customers to try Google’s Stadia gaming service.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Something called an “imagination space,” a 17-foot round glass structure where you can experience Google’s latest and greatest services.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A showroom for Google’s hardware products, such as Pixel phones.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Google is not going all-in on physical retail like Apple, but it’s at least trying to put in a better effort than Microsoft. The company that graced us with Excel closed <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/26/21297400/microsoft-retail-stores-closing-cities-open?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all of its Microsoft Store locations</a> except four last year.</p>

<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Three Headline and a Lie
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re not going to sugarcoat it: This week’s Three Headlines and a Lie is a little (and a lot) gross. See if you can spot which headlines are real and which one is fake. Whatever happens, you're welcome for the imagery.</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NBC’s </span><span><em>Ultimate Slip N’ Slide</em></span><span> competition show </span><span><a href="https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2021/06/nbcs-ultimate-slip-n-slide-competition-show-halted-due-to-explosive-diarrhea?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">halted</a></span><span> due to “explosive diarrhea”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An Olympic hopeful </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/06/15/1006622129/an-olympic-hopeful-says-her-burrito-is-to-blame-for-her-positive-drug-test?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says</a></span><span> her burrito is to blame for her positive drug test</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Petition </span><span><a href="https://www.foxnews.com/lifestyle/petition-urging-jeff-bezos-to-buy-and-eat-the-mona-lisa-gains-hundreds-of-signatures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urging</a></span><span> Jeff Bezos to buy and eat the Mona Lisa gains steam</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjMwL2plcm9tZV9wb3dlbGwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlex Wong/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust like your friend’s Covid-delayed wedding, the Fed’s interest rate hikes \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/fed-expected-flag-start-monetary-policy-shift-debate-2021-06-16/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinally have a date\u003c/a\u003e: 2023. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy then, central bankers project, the economy will be in a strong enough position for the Fed to raise interest rates that influence everything from mortgages to business investments. 2023 is one year earlier than the Fed’s previous estimates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy move the timeline up? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll those sweet, sweet antibodies coursing through your immune system. Says the Fed: “Progress on vaccinations has reduced the spread of Covid-19 in the United States\" and therefore “indicators of economic activity and employment have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/federal-reserve-meeting-interest-rates-bond-purchases-june-2021-11623777582?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrengthened\u003c/a\u003e.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNearly 45% of the US population is fully vaccinated, and hard-hit states like California and New York removed most Covid-related restrictions this week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here: \u003c/strong\u003eIn March 2020, the Fed dropped interest rates to near-zero and launched a barrage of stimulus measures to steer the economy through its darkest days. It worked pretty well, and the question the Fed’s faced recently is: When has the economy recovered enough that these stimulus efforts, including a bond-buying program and super-low interest rates, aren’t needed? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re not there yet. The Fed said it wouldn’t further update its strategy until “substantial further progress” is made. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut what about inflation? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Fed has been pressured to pump the brakes on the economy after a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/12/inflation-rising-economy-weird?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erun-up in prices\u003c/a\u003e this spring led to the highest inflation readings in years. Powell has consistently argued that higher inflation is temporary, but now he may be taking it a little more seriously: “Inflation could turn out to be higher and more persistent than we expect,” he \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/YahooFinance/status/1405236329806446592?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e, while the Fed revised its inflation expectations higher. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe interest rate hikes in 2023 are just central bankers’ expectations, and could change based on the shape of the recovery. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what did they say about cybersecurity?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemember, both the hack of Colonial Pipeline, which led to a gas shortage on the Eastern seaboard, and the forced shut down of meat supplier JBS’s facilities in the US have been attributed to cybercrime groups operating in Russia.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat Biden wants: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRussia to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/06/16/putin-biden-cybersecurity-494875?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etake responsibility\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for cybercriminals acting within its borders.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat Biden got: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePutin agreed to “begin consultations” regarding cybersecurity with the US. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Just last week, Russia, along with 20+ other countries including the US, agreed not to shelter cybercriminals or be involved in the hacking of other nations’ infrastructure (like the Colonial Pipeline) during peacetime. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGet ready for the most intense season of \u003cem\u003eHouse Hunters\u003c/em\u003e you’ve ever seen, because construction of homes in the US in the last 20 years is 5.5 million units short of historical levels, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/race-and-ethnicity-health-coronavirus-pandemic-lifestyle-business-cdce22f5ae976032e9e6fa89831c0a93?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" (NAR).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic only made the bad, worse, when supply chain bottlenecks and labor shortages throttled new development. Now, the US is experiencing a housing affordability crisis: The median price of an existing home hit an all-time high of $341,600 in April, up 19% from 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e There aren’t enough houses being built to account for population growth, aging and destroyed units, or even to replace all the haunted farmhouses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ein response to the report, top WH economic advisor Brian Deese \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/BrianDeeseNEC/status/1405189344416210954?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e, “We need a once-in-a-generation investment in increasing housing supply.” NAR released a slew of policy recommendations to accompany the report, hoping they can be folded into President Biden’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/15/infrastructure-bipartisan-senate-plan-faces-opposition-from-democrats.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eThe launch of brick-and-mortar retail may seem odd for a company that makes $147 billion in revenue from digital ads. But the store is intended less as a sales generator and more as a brand-building exercise. Some highlights include...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA room full of flatscreen TVs for customers to try Google’s Stadia gaming service.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSomething called an “imagination space,” a 17-foot round glass structure where you can experience Google’s latest and greatest services.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA showroom for Google’s hardware products, such as Pixel phones.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Google is not going all-in on physical retail like Apple, but it’s at least trying to put in a better effort than Microsoft.
